_exec_summary.SummaryText:
DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The Galena Park Facility is a butane blending facility.  The facility is located in Houston, Texas.  The 40 CFR 68 regulated substance at this facility is butane.  Butane is held on-site in piping in a quantity greater than 10,000 lbs for blending into gasoline.  The maximum line fill inventory is 77,408 lbs of butane.  



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

The Galena Park Terminal has a strong commitment to worker and public safety, along with resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and contractors in design, installation, operations, and maintenance procedures.  If an emergency were to occur, it is Magellan's policy to notify the Galena Park LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM

The regulated butane blending process in the facility is compliant with all elements of the Risk Management Program (RMP) and other employee training programs, along with operating and maintenance procedures.  The process controls listed in Section 7.4e were chosen based on whether or not they were used as safeguards in the initial PHA for this facility.  There may be other process controls in this facility that were not identified as safeguards in the initial PHA.  The facility has no "Trade Secrets".  The facility complies with the Federal and State requirements for leak detection of valves and flanges.  Inspections are conducted and documented to ensure the integrity of the regulated equipment.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no accidental releases from the butane blending process at the Galena Park terminal.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The facility is considered a non-responding facility.  The facility maintains a written Emergency Response Plan.  In the event of fire or explosion, or a release of a regulated substance from the butane process, entry within the distance to

the specified endpoint may pose a danger to public emergency responders.  Therefore, emergency responders should not enter the area except as arranged with the emergency contact indicated within the RMP.  The undersigned certifies that to the best of my knowledge, information, and belief, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

No changes are currently planned to the butane blending process.  As opportunities for improvement associated with the new butane process arise at the Galena Park Terminal, they will be evaluated by Magellan Terminal Holdings, L.P.
